ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Does Heritrix considers the hash (#) in a URL?
ygData.msgSnippet: IIRC, yes, anything past the # is ignored.  Two URLs that different only in the component that follows the # are considered the same (I do not recall whether

IIRC, yes, anything past the # is ignored.  Two URLs that different only 
in the component that follows the # are considered the same (I do not 
recall whether the crawler drops the '#' and its component when it 
writes the (W)ARC).

Usually the right-hand-side of the # refers to an anchor within the page.

Why would you want the crawler to consider it?

St.Ack
